channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024030297
item.description:
Report X-2024030297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on van line when it was found wet, after inspecting, one bottle of Isopropanol Alcohol was found with broken seal and cap completely off causing internal leakage. DescribePack: 1 gallon of 99% Isopropanol Alcohol, seal and cap came off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Rough handling/ Cap may have already been loose before shipping and with liquid weight shifting, seal became damaged.

item.title: Report X-2024030339
item.description:
Report X-2024030339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer laying sideways with the package orientation arrows facing sideways and the side of the box being wet. The hazmat package was put in a hazmat tote and brought to the QA cage for damage processing. DescribePack: The failure looks to have occurred with the cap on the bag which wound up leaking due to the package being loaded incorrectly into the trailer, which was from the package being laid on the side with the orientation arrows facing sideways instead of upwards. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat package was put in a hazmat tote lined with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024030372
item.description:
Report X-2024030372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking hazmat, when admin arrived package was already in a lined tote with a large puddle of product on the floor from where it had been leaking. Spill pads were used to clean up large quantity of spilled product then neutralizer was used over top of spill. After neutralizer sat for a minute it was swept up. DescribePack: Body of hard plastic bag inside of fiberboard box looked as if a side seam burst due to impact with the floor or another hard object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in a lined tote in an upright postion.

item.title: Report X-2024030143
item.description:
Report X-2024030143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD A SMALL AMOUNT OF DRY ICE VAPOR COMING FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO BIOHAZARD BAGS CONTAINING SPECIMENS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE IS A RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED STICKER AFFIXED TO ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MARYLAND USING THE CONSIGNEE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 442F01, AXIS CLINICALS, 1711 CENTER AVE W, DILWORTH MN 56529-1342.

item.title: Report X-2024030169
item.description:
Report X-2024030169

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called due to a leaking hazmat, hazmat was immediately put into a lined tote when admin arrived to spill. Nuetralizer was used on spilled product, nuetralizer was cleaned up. DescribePack: Cap came loose on one bottle of product inside package causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightend and package was kept in an upright postion in a lined tote to prevent further leakage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Caps on bottles came loose causing inner leakage, package was put into a hazmat bin to conceal the leakage. DescribePack: Caps on bottles loosened, and package was wet from spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: put the package into a spill tote
